Package mmj.lang

Class Assrt

java.lang.Object
mmj.lang.MObj
mmj.lang.Stmt
mmj.lang.Assrt
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.json.JSONString
Direct Known Subclasses:
Axiom, Theorem
public abstract class Assrt extends Stmt
Assrt is an "Assertion", of which there are two main kinds, Axiom and Theorem -- known in Metamath as "Axiomatic Assertions" and "Provable Assertions". What do Assertions have in common that Hypotheses do not? "Mandatory" Frames.
See Also:
  • Nomenclature and Entity-Relationship Notes

  • Field Details

    • varHypArray

      protected VarHyp[] varHypArray
      varHypArray contains *exactly* the Assrt's Formula's VarHyp's, in database sequence.

      varHypArray is an array of length zero if the Assrt's Formula contains no variables.

      Note: varHypArray is somewhat redundant, but note that MandFrame contains not only VarHyp's used in an Expression's Formula, but the LogHyp's that are in scope, and the VarHyp's used by those LogHyp's!.

    • logHypArray

      protected LogHyp[] logHypArray
      logHypArray contains *exactly* the Assrt's Formula's LogHyp's, in database sequence.

      logHypArray is an array of length zero if the Assrt has no LogHyp's.

      logHypArray is redundant with the data in ScopeFrame, but ProofAsst needs quick access to the LogHyp's as well as the actual number of LogHyp's.

    • mandFrame

      protected ScopeFrame mandFrame
      The assertion's Mandatory Frame.

    • NBR_LOG_HYP_SEQ

      public static final Comparator<Assrt> NBR_LOG_HYP_SEQ

    • Assrt

      public Assrt(int seq, List<ScopeDef> scopeDefList, Map<String,Sym> symTbl, Map<String,Stmt> stmtTbl, String labelS, String typS, List<String> symList) throws LangException
      Construct using a boatload of parameters.
      Parameters:
      seq - MObj.seq number
      scopeDefList - the Scope list
      symTbl - Symbol Table (Map)
      stmtTbl - Statement Table (Map)
      labelS - Label String identifying the Assrt
      typS - Type Code String (first sym of formula)
      symList - Formula's Expression (2nd thru nth syms)
      Throws:
      LangException - variety of errors :)

  • Method Details

    • getMandVarHypArray

      public VarHyp[] getMandVarHypArray()
      Return the *mandatory* varHypArray.

      Note: the "varHypArray" contains only *mandatory* VarHyp's, hence the name of this function, which is intended to highlight the point. These are the VarHyp's use in the Assrt's Formula.

      Specified by:
      getMandVarHypArray in class Stmt
      Returns:
      varHypArray which contains only mandatory VarHyp's.

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Is the Assrt "active".

      Yep. Always. An assertion is always "active" even if it is defined inside a scope level. (Recall that, in practice, "active" simply means that a statement can be referred to by a subsequent statement in a proof or parse RPN.)

      That is because Metmath "scope" is designed primarily to limit the visibility of hypotheses so that variables can be reused with different Types and so that logical hypotheses can be applied to just a single assertion. In a sense, Metamath scopes are merely notational shorthand, and as Metamath.pdf explains, every assertion has an "Extended Frame" (look it up for more info.)

      Specified by:
      isActive in class Stmt
      Returns:
      true (assertions are always "active")

    • loadLogHypArray

      public void loadLogHypArray()
      Loads the logHypArray using mandFrame.

      This is pretty redundant, but is an add-on for ProofAsst and is designed to be as bombproof as possible -- the output logHypArray is guaranteed to be in database sequence because it is created from MandFrame.hypArray.

    • accumHypInList

      public static <T extends Hyp> void accumHypInList(List<T> hypList, T hypNew)
      Accumulate unique hypotheses (no duplicates), storing them in an array list in order of their appearance in the database.

      The input "hypList" is updated with unique variable hypotheses in the expression.

      Because hypList is maintained in database statement sequence order, hypList should either be empty (new) before the call, or already be in that order.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the actual type of the list
      Parameters:
      hypList - List of Hyp's, updated here.
      hypNew - Candidate Hyp to be added to hypList if not already there.

    • getLogHypsMaxDepth

      public int getLogHypsMaxDepth()
      Dynamically computes, if needed, the larges maximum depth of parse trees of logHypArray, and caches the value for later use.
      Returns:
      greatest maxDepth of parse trees for logHypArray.

    • getLogHypsL1HiLoKey

      public String getLogHypsL1HiLoKey()
      Dynamically computes, if needed, the Hi and Lo keys of Level 1 (root) of parse trees of logHypArray, and caches the value for later use.
      Returns:
      Level 1 HiLoKey of parse trees for logHypArray.
